alert.note: Alert for Okanogan Highlands; Okanogan Valley; Upper Columbia Basin; Waterville Plateau; Wenatchee Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 08 at 2:46PM PST until December 10 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM SATURDAY TO 10 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow accumulations will range from 2 to 5 inches around Wenatchee and the Waterville Plateau and 2 to 3 inches elsewhere. Over the Columbia Basin most of the snow accumulations will be located north of Highway 2. Brief freezing rain will also be possible Saturday evening into early Sunday morning, mainly over the Waterville Plateau and Wenatchee area. * WHERE...Chesaw Road, Highway 20 Wauconda Summit, Number 1 Canyon, Omak, Nespelem, Coulee City, Creston, Pangborn Airport, Disautel Pass, Inchelium, Sherman Pass, Bridgeport, Harrington, Oroville, Republic, Number 2 Canyon, Boulder Creek Road, Wenatchee, Badger Mountain Road, Wilbur, Okanogan, Odessa, Ritzville, Brewster, Grand Coulee, Wauconda, Tonasket, Mansfield, Cashmere, Waterville, Entiat, and Chelan. * WHEN...From 10 AM Saturday to 10 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest travel information in Washington, go to https://wsdot.wa.gov/travel

area.areaDesc: Okanogan Highlands; Okanogan Valley; Upper Columbia Basin; Waterville Plateau; Wenatchee Area
